nodes.bodyText: Not sure if this is enforced, but better to left-align the text with the header line.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -90,6 +90,29 @@ following aggregate functions:
 * :func:`var_pop`
 * :func:`var_samp`
 
+Table Properties
+----------------
+
+Table property usage example:
+
+.. code-block:: sql
+
+    CREATE TABLE myschema.scientists (
+      recordkey VARCHAR,
+      name VARCHAR,
+      age BIGINT,
+      birthday DATE
+    )
+    WITH (
+      data_compression = 'ROW'
+    );
+
+==================== ================ ======================================================================================================
+Property Name        Default Value    Description
+==================== ================ ======================================================================================================
+``data_compression``   (none)           DataCompression for SQL Server tables. Can either be `NONE`, 'ROW` or `PAGE`.

nodes.bodyText: Dont use a table if it is only one property at all. And in general might be better to use list-table (see other documentation for examples)

nodes.bodyText: @Praveen2112 thoughts providing some SQLServer reference here that explains the properties in more detail?
well... is any property supported? If yes.. we should list them all or link to documentation where they are listed.
As of now we support only one property.

Turn the sentence around
You can specify the data compression policy for SQL Server tables with the ...

+You can specify the `data compression policy for SQL Server tables
